intro: Tylophora deightonii, commonly known as the Chinese bellflower, is a flowering plant native to China and Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, with opposite, ovate leaves and milky sap. It is often found in moist, shady environments such as forests and mountainous regions. Tylophora deightonii is also valued in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
